comments:
Twice Eclipse has gotten into a state where when I try to add a breakpoint 
(using the toggle breakpoint menu item) I get the error "Marker id: 31423 not 
found" (or some number).  Restarting Eclipse fixes the problem.

It looks like the following log entry might be related:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.jdt.debug.ui 4 150 May 13, 2004 18:36:17.812

Any steps to reproduce? It looks like we have a breakpoint with a missing 
(underlying) marker.

Unfortunately I have yet to figure out how Eclipse got into this state. I'll try 
to keep track of when it might happen.
For now, marking as works for me
It hasn't occurred with 3.0RC1, so it may be fixed.
